name: Ibis Budget Southampton Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting there; The directions given by the hotel website are easy to follow and the hotel easily seen from road .
reviews.title: Value Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel; The hotel is good value, the check in was easy the reception staff pleasant. The room was basic but clean and adequate for a one or two night stopover. The continental breakfast at £ 2.90p was average and the breakfast area got crowded,. If I stayed again I would probably opt for the 24 hr Mac Donalds that is next to the hotel.
reviews.title: A decent refuge for the beleaguered American traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Area; located approx 5 min walk from Southampton City Centre and a large shopping mall with the usual shops and cafes. The main street didnt have as many good bars and cafes as I thought it would, the West end of the street was a bit rough, noticable by the Police presence outside Yates Bar. The East end was better with some Cafes/Restaurants in the Oxford Street area
reviews.title: okay but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I are cruisers who like to arrive at the port the day prior to embarkation. Last year, we stayed in the Southampton Ibis and felt that it was not a particularly good value. On the grounds that a hotel could not be much more basic than the Ibis, this year we tried the new Etap that was almost half the price of the Ibis. We are glad we did. The room, while not fancy, had a comfortable bed (and pillows). The bath facility came with only one towel, but it was large and soft. The meager bar of soap was no smaller than that provided by the pricier Ibis. The breakfast, at 3 GBP, was a good value; indeed the croissants were freshly baked and quite nice. The staff was helpful, giving us some needed assistance with the luggage as well as getting us a cab for the transfer to the ship. In these days of the diminishing dollar, the Etap is a decent refuge for the beleaguered American traveler.
reviews.title: All around good deal for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently booked the Etap hotel for a stopover with my partner to visit family.
reviews.title: Basic but good value

description: Ibis Budget Southampton - the smart traveller's choice! Our modern, comfortable room can accommodate up to 3 people, with a shower, toilet, and flat-screen TV, all for a very low price. And the next day you help yourself at our good for value breakfast buffet!
